Wisdom: شَرُّ مَا شَغَلَ بِهِ الْمَرْءُ وَقْتَهُ الْفُضُولُ
enWisdom: The worst thing which a person occupies his time with is the superfluous
The wastage of intellects is in seeking the superfluous

Wisdom: طَاعَةُ الْجَهُولِ وَكَثْرَةُ الْفُضُولِ تَدُلَّانِ عَلَى الْجَهْلِ
enWisdom: Obedience to the foolish and being excessive [in speech or action] are two signs of ignorance

Wisdom: مَنْ أَمْسَكَ عَنِ الْفُضُولِ عَدَّلَتْ رَأْيَهُ‏ الْعُقُولُ
enWisdom: Whoever restrains himself from the superfluous, his view is harmonized by the intellects

Wisdom: مَنِ اشْتَغَلَ بِالْفُضُولِ فَاتَهُ مِنْ مُهِمَّةِ الْمَأْمُولِ
enWisdom: Whoever occupies himself with the superfluous, the important matter that he hopes for eludes him

Wisdom: اقْصِرْ هِمَّتَكَ عَلَى مَا يَلْزَمُكَ وَلَا تَخُضْ فِيمَا لَا يَعْنِيكَ
enWisdom: Confine your endeavour to that which is necessary for you and do not enter into that which does not concern you

Wisdom: اقْصِرْ رَأْيَكَ عَلَى مَا يَلْزَمُكَ تَسْلَمْ وَدَعِ الْخَوْضَ فِيمَا لَا يَعْنِيكَ تُكْرَمْ
enWisdom: Restrict your opinion to that which is necessary and you will be safe; avoid entering into that which does not concern you and you will be honoured

Wisdom: أَعْرِضُوا عَنْ كُلِّ عَمَلٍ بِكُمْ غِنًى عَنْهُ وَاشْغَلُوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ مِنْ أَمْرِ الْآخِرَةِ بِمَا لَا بُدَّ لَكُمْ مِنْهُ
enWisdom: Eschew every action that you are in no need of and busy yourself with the affair of the Hereafter, which you must [eventually] face

Wisdom: أَكْبَرُ الْكُلْفَةِ تَعَنِّيكَ فِيمَا لَا يَعْنِيكَ
enWisdom: The greatest inconvenience is troubling yourself with that which does not concern you

Wisdom: بِتَرْكِ مَا لَا يَعْنِيكَ يَتِمُّ لَكَ الْعَقْلُ
enWisdom: By leaving that which does not concern you, your intellect becomes complete

Wisdom: دَعْ مَا لَا يَعْنِيكَ وَاشْتَغِلْ بِمُهِمِّكَ الَّذِي يُنْجِيكَ
enWisdom: Leave aside that which does not concern you and busy yourself with the important work that will save you [in the Hereafter]

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ غَفْلَةً أَنْ يَصْرِفَ هِمَّتَهُ فِيمَا لَا يَعْنِيهِ
enWisdom: It is enough of negligence for a person to waste his efforts in that which does not concern [or benefit] him

Wisdom: مَنِ اشْتَغَلَ بِمَا لَا يَعْنِيهِ فَاتَهُ مَا يَعْنِيهِ
enWisdom: One who occupies himself with that which does not concern him loses that which is important to him

Wisdom: مَنِ اشْتَغَلَ بِغَيْرِ الْمُهِمِّ ضَيَّعَ الْأَهَمَّ
enWisdom: One who is occupied by the unimportant loses that which is more important

Wisdom: مَنْ أَتْعَبَ نَفْسَهُ فِيمَا لَا يَنْفَعُهُ وَقَعَ فِيمَا يَضُرُّهُ
enWisdom: Whoever troubles himself with that which does not benefit him gets caught in that which harms him

Wisdom: مَنِ اطَّرَحَ مَا يَعْنِيهِ وَقَعَ إِلَى مَا لَا يَعْنِيهِ
enWisdom: One who eliminates malice [from his heart], his heart and mind become relaxed

Wisdom: مَنِ اشْتَغَلَ بِغَيْرِ ضَرُورَتِهِ فَوَّتَهُ ذَلِكَ مَنْفَعَتَهُ
enWisdom: Whoever occupies himself with that which is unnecessary, it causes him to lose [what is more to] his benefit

Wisdom: وُقُوعُكَ فِيمَا لَا يَعْنِيكَ جَهْلٌ مُضِلٌّ
enWisdom: Your getting involved in that which is of no concern to you is misguided ignorance

Wisdom: لَا تَشْتَغِلْ بِمَا لَا يَعْنِيكَ وَلَا تَتَكَلَّفْ فَوْقَ مَا يَكْفِيكَ وَاجْعَلْ كُلَّ هَمِّكَ لِمَا يُنْجِيكَ
enWisdom: Do not busy yourself with that which is of no concern to you, and do not take upon yourself more than what is enough for you, and exert all your efforts for that which will save you
